page.description: Search and replace values in a field in all currently visible rows in the Grid.

item.name: Field to update
item.description: Specify the field to update. You can use <CurrentField> to indicate the field that currently has focus.

item.name: Read 'search' value from
item.description: Specify the ID of an element from which the 'search' value will be read.

item.name: Read 'replace' value from
item.description: Specify the ID of an element from which the 'replace' value will be read.

item.name: All instances in field
item.description: Replace all instances of the search phrase. If unchecked, only the first instance is changed.

item.name: Case insensitive
item.description: Specify if the search should be case insensitive.

item.name: Rows to update
item.description: Specify which rows should be updated. 'AllVisibleRows' - all visible existing record rows and all new record rows, 'AllVisibleExistingRecordRows' - all visible existing record rows, but not new record rows. 'AllNewRecordRows' - only new record rows. 'CheckedRows' - only rows that have been checked. Choices include.

item.name: Prompt for confirmation
item.description: Before updating a non-blank value, prompt for confirmation?

item.name: Confirmation message
item.description: Specify the template to use for the confirmation message. The message can include these placeholders: [row] - row number, [old] - old value in field, and [new] - new value for field.

videos.title: Global Search and Replace in a Grid Component

description.p: When doing data entry into a Grid there may be times when the user wants to perform a search and replace operation on the data the currently visible rows in the Grid. Using Action Javascript, it is easy to make a button does a 'global search and replace' on all visible rows in the Grid.
It is important to recognize that the action shown in this video is a 'client-side' action. No data is actually written to the database until the user clicks the 'Submit' button.
